greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Interpolation operator: Triangle with an even number of zeros in each line followed by 1 or 2 ones.
comment: Inverse of A133080: sub diagonal changes to (-1, 0, -1, 0, -1,...); main diagonal unchanged.
In A133081, diagonal terms are switched with subdiagonal terms.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
formula: Infinite lower triangular matrix, (1,1,1...) in the main diagonal and (1,0,1,0,1,...) in the subdiagonal.
Odd rows, (n-1) zeros followed by "1". Even rows, (n-2) zeros followed by "1, 1".
T(n,n)=1. T(n,k)=0 if 1<=k<n-1. T(n,n-1)=1 if n even. T(n,n-1)=0 if n odd. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 14 2015
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 1, n}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 21 2017 *)
program: (PARI) T(n, k) = if (k==n, 1, if (k == (n-1), 1 - (n % 2), 0)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 13 2014
(PARI) firstrows(n) = {my(res = vector(binomial(n + 1, 2)), t=0); for(i=1, n, t+=i; res[t] = 1; if(i%2==0, res[t-1]=1)) ;res} \\ _David A. Corneth_, Oct 21 2017
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 08 2007
